answers.answer: Hi dana,How are you? It is good to hear that the diagnostic tests done were normal. Aside from ear issues, dizziness can also be due to environmental factors, eye conditions  such as error of refraction, blood pressure changes or from underlying medical conditions like anemia, diabetes, vertigo and many other illnesses. Additional tests like blood tests and other imaging studies may need to be done to determine the underlying cause. You may also benefit from a referral to an opthalmologist. Take care and do keep us posted.

question: dshalashDear Mr.. Doctor ,am a girl 33 years old , i ve been suffering from a pressure on my head and suddenly dizzness then a tinny headachethe dizzness last for few minitues not more than 5 mins... i feel that the dezzness  appears much more in some condition  when i exposed to some kinds of light such as spot lights !!so i asked many doctors i did Brain MRI it was normal MRI doctor said nothing sriouse my inner ear is perfect , the brain is perfect too , but still suffering from dizzness .would like to know what is the reason behind that dizzness ? is the spot light a reason for such dizzness and what should i do for that , am really got tired from that ?will you please help me?thank youdana
title: presseure on head and dizzness
